{{font|[https://online-fonts.com/fonts/tengwar-parmaite Tengwar Parmaite] by [[Måns Björkman]]}} {{disambig-more|Elbereth|[[Elbereth (disambiguation)]]}} '''A Elbereth Gilthoniel''' or '''Aerlinn in edhil o Imladris''' is an ''[[aerlinn]]'' (poem) of [[Rivendell]] addressed to [[Varda]], sung in [[Sindarin]] and in iambic tetrameter. The first stanza (the only one known) rhymes ''aababcc''. ==Poem== [[File:J.R.R. Tolkien - A Elbereth Gilthoniel.mp3|thumb|[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] reads A Elbereth Gilthoniel]] {| | ] ljwl7l3 s`j3h6`lj | ''A Elbereth Gilthoniel |- | 8`j`r7l6 ql5] y`V7`lj | ''silivren penna míriel |- | h yl6lj ]sj]7 ljl6]3Á | ''o menel aglar elenath! |- | 6]d]Ý7l2 q]j]62`V7`lj | ''Na-chaered palan-díriel |- | h s]j]47lt`6 l5h7]3= | ''o galadhremmin ennorath, |- | e]6.Õjh8= jl j`5]3h6 | ''Fanuilos, le linnathon |- | 6lr ]Ý]7= 8`V 6lr ]Ý]7h6Á | ''nef aear, sí nef aearon! |} ===Translation=== :''O Elbereth Starkindler
(white) glittering slants down
sparkling like jewels
from [the] firmament [the] glory [of] the star-host!
To-remote distance far-having gazed
from [the] tree-tangled middle-lands,
[[Fanuilos]], to thee I will chant
on this side of ocean, here on this side of the Great Ocean!''{{RGEO|Notes}} The rest of it is not saved but it is possible that ''[[Elven Hymn to Elbereth|Oh Snow-white]]'' is a [[Westron]] translation or variation of this aerlinn. Variations of this hymn are sung throughout the book, such as the very last one written down: {{blockquote|...and as if in answer, from down below, coming up the road out of the valley, voices sang: :A! Elbereth Gilthoniel!
silivren penna míriel
o menel aglar elenath,
Gilthoniel, A! Elbereth!
We still remember, we who dwell
In this far land beneath the trees
The starlight on the Western Seas.|[[Frodo Baggins]] in ''[[The Return of the King]]'', "[[The Grey Havens]]"}} ==Legacy== [[Donald Swann]] wrote music for this song, which can be found in the book ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'' where Tolkien gives also a [[Tengwar]] text of the poem in the [[Mode of Beleriand]] given above;{{RGEO|7}} it is also found on the accompanying CD of the latest version. A different musical version was recorded by the [[Tolkien Ensemble]]. The first version cited above can be found on their album ''[[A Night in Rivendell]]'', and takes the form of a chant sung by a female soloist. The second version can be found on the album ''[[At Dawn in Rivendell]]''. Another musical version was composed by the Russian Tolkienite band [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79i12JMzzT4 Aire and Saruman]. [[Tolkien Journal (Vol.2, No.1)|''Tolkien Journal'' (Vol.2, No.1)]] 1966, included the poem and an English translation by Tolkien.''An Illustrated Tolkien Bibliography'', at Tolkienbooks.net {{references}} [[Category:Poems in The Fellowship of the Ring]] [[Category:Sindarin texts]] [[Category:Songs]] [[de:A Elbereth Gilthoniel]] [[fr:langues/langues elfiques/sindarin/elbereth gilthoniel]] [[fi:A Elbereth Gilthoniel]]
